However, DiMeglio occasionally tried to bridge this gap by offering lab photos in addition to the recordings. 

This course also involved live discussion sections with teaching fellows for remote students. I personally thought that this was very helpful, as it gave students an additional chance to review the lab procedure and ask questions (given that watching a lab video online will never be as engaging as doing the lab in person).
I think the in-person component was successful, and I hope that this is continued for the next part of the sequence.
Since I took the course in-person, it was pretty similar to a normal semester.
The format of the class worked for me. I am glad there is an in-person option for students on campus.
My engagement was not hindered due to this course being in-person, and health and safety precautions were followed well.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: It will only ever be taken as a requirement and will rarely contribute something you couldn't get from orgo lecture or real lab experience.
If you have to take it for Pre-med then do so, but if you don't then it's not worth it. The work load is too high for a 0.5 credit class.
I would only recommend this lab if you are required to take it. And when you take it, prepare to have the workload of a 1.5 credit course.
yes, for those in organic chemistry i
I recommend it if you need the lab credit.
Yeah. You probably have to take it for pre med, but it's definitely better than gen chem lab in my experience, and overall I still enjoyed it
just a pre-med requirement
Take it if you have to or if you like orgo.

I would recommend this course to any student taking the lecture in organic chemistry as a welcome supplement that not only teaches lab technique but sometimes gives a better, simpler explanation of concepts that are also covered in lecture.
Absolutely--it's quite a bit of work for a 0.5 credit class, but it serves as a great introduction to lab etiquette and safety culture, along with several basic procedures

Yes! If you're taking this class it's probably because you have to, but I felt that I learned a lot and enjoyed the experiments. Opt for in-person if your circumstances allow -- its more challenging, but much more rewarding.
This is a great course. Don't worry if you are a first year without any prior lab experience; the professor and TA are very supportive and are great people in general.
Yes. For many students, this is a requirement anyway. It's a solid course, and that lab experience that you get is definitely important to have.
yes
yes if they want to learn organic chemistry lab techniques
Yes, it was very low stress for a lab and I still felt like I learned a lot. It is necessary for pre-med, but was enjoyable.
Yes. Doctor D is great at making everyone feel welcome and the in-person lab was a great experience.

No, unless you have to take the class for your major or are looking to do research in an organic chemistry lab. The course does teach you the necessary experimental techniques for doing organic chemistry reactions in a real lab, but the workload for this class seems unreasonable. I would not take it for fun.
Yes if they are taking Organic Chem.
Yes, it is a great introduction to the organic chemistry laboratory environment and techniques.
I would recommend this course to anyone who is taking the organic chemistry lecture. This course was great for practicing laboratory skills.

This course is very interesting and helped me grow as a scientist and student. However, the 4 hour lab days plus pre/post lab assignments that often took 3-6 hours made this a very rigorous course. The work was generally enjoyable but it is much more than you would expect from a 0.5 credit course.
I recommend taking this course if a student needs to fulfill a requirement or is interested in chemistry.
Yes
I would recommend this course to another student if they are very interested in the subject matter or require it for their major/pre-med requirements.
Yes, take lab while taking the organic lecture! It's a more hands-on experience that helps clarify some of the more abstract topics in lecture.

Absolutely, this class made orgo that much more bearable because you felt like you were actually understanding the material and how it actually applies in the laboratory setting. Definitely take this with orgo since it helps with conceptualization.

I would recommend this course to another student because it provided me with invaluable skills that I will be able to use later on in my career. It also was very nice to see how this lab course and the orgo lecture course were in conversation with one another especially when learning about SN1/SN2 reactions. Being able to actually do those reactions was a great learning experience.
Definitely take a chem lab. It is good to learn how to safely use materials and equipment in a class setting.
Definitely! Dr. Dimeglio is awesome, the course material is interesting, and they did a great job converting everything to being virtual

I would recommend this course to students who are genuinely interested in understanding the chemistry behind different lab techniques and methods. The workload of this course is weighty, but it is necessary for one's learning and understanding. Students who take this course should have the intention of putting forward their best effort; this is not an easy course, but it is a worthwhile investment.
Yes, most people who take it take it as a requirement anyway and this is a refreshing change from Gen Chem lab
For a lab course, this is a good one. The set up during the pandemic is extremely beneficial to students and is a manageable workload.

This is a very work-heavy course and should be worth much more than 0.5 credits. I'd only recommend it if you're willing to put in the grunt work of studying, preparing lab reports/plans, and working hard in the actual lab.

Just like with organic chemistry the class, I would have a really hard time thinking of a reason you would want to take organic chemistry lab for a reason other than requirements for a major or pre-med. It's not terrible, but it's just one of those classes that is way too much work for a topic that really isn't that interesting to be a class I'd recommend as a "fun class." As long as you don't leave your PLs to the last minute and you adjust quickly to the grading guidelines of your TA, you should be alright in this lab.

I would recommend this course if you need it for your major or if you're interested in improving your lab skills and technique. If you aren't interested in the material, it would definitely be more challenging, but the instructors and course organization are great!
Only if they have to take it

I really enjoyed this course. I honestly could say I had fun in lab, even with the restrictions and protocols. My TA was so helpful, and constantly pushed us to think critically about what was actually happening in our experiments. I felt very safe and supported, and was not afraid to make mistakes. The EPs were tedious but prepared us well for the experiments, so that we could be independent and confident during lab. At the same time, I got to know my fellow lab students a bit, and everyone was very friendly and collaborative. I liked this class because it felt practical, and it was exciting to see reactions occur, even if they were "right" or "wrong". Dr. D and all the lab staff were so caring and helpful, too! It was tough at times, and the labs/write-ups could be long, but in the end I'm glad I took it.
Yes I would recommend. I felt like the techniques and information were nicely taught.
Yes! This is a great lab option for anyone who is taking Organic Chemistry and needs to complete a lab.

Most students who take orgo lab due so because they are required to. If you want experience working in a chemical lab, I would recommend asking for a spot at an actual Yale lab, where you can learn all the skills you need to succeed without the resentment towards writing reports coming from the need to nitpick every word to avoid a complete destruction of GPA.
If this person wants to learn the basics for organic chemistry lab and techniques used, this is the class for them.
I would definitely recommend this course to any student who needs to fulfill a lab for organic chemistry. The course is taught very clearly and the work is very manageable and clear.

If you are required to do this for your major or pre-med, definitely do it since it is probably better than taking gen chem lab. If you choose to do this, remember to allocate your time wisely for the Post lab assignments, collaborate with fellow peers and keep an open line of communication with your TA.
Yeah, teaches some important stuff for ochem
Only if they were taking organic chemistry during the same semester.
Yes. It is a major requirement in most cases, but I enjoy the course and how well it alined with Orgo lecture. Overall, well done!
Yes, this lab course was pretty straightforward and a good deviance to the rest of my schedule

No. Not very accommodating or thoughtful towards student needs and evidence of learning and overall just really hard to take online. Can't say anything for in person though, I imagine it would be a totally different experience.
Yes. This course was a good introduction to Orgo Lab.

Yes, this lab class was really great in covering a lot of useful organic lab procedures and the concepts were presented in an understandable manner. This class is also obviously a prerequisite for other more advanced science courses.
Yes. It is a good lab course that would be even better in person. It is structured well and is quite organized, follows the material in lecture, and is not extremely complicated.

Only if you get a reasonable TA. This will make or break your experience. I had peers who took this course and had a very decent experience but some who would always end up beyond frustrated on their lab days.

It will probably be required for most people but yes I would definitely recommend taking this lab if you are taking orgo lecture (though it doesn't really need to be taken together but some topics overlap and are helpful in understanding a few topics). I personally thought that I learned much more and got more out of class than the actual orgo course. You will learn quite a lot and getting in hand experience in a lab is really helpful in the future for premeds and STEM majors. This lab is rather hands-off (which personally I liked but I had prior lab experience) and if you go into class without being prepared, you will 100% be lost as the only things you go over before you start the experiments are the chemical concepts and safety concerns. There are also two flaws in the class that I found. FIrst is the grading system which varies a lot between TAs (I had a B+ based on the assignments/quizzes alone but was curved to an A since my TA was a harsh grader) and you don't know how you're doing until after the final. Second is the assignments that need to be done outside of class. The experimental plans and lab notes seem tedious at times and usually you spent 2-3 hours before lab for each EP and another 2-3 hours after for the LN (though this might be on the higher end since my TA was very picky). Also the lab reports (there are two) took a decent bulk of time and you often get points taken off for reasons that you don't really know. However, overall, the lab I found to be a pretty great course. Just be wary going in that you might get a lot more work depending on your TA (not more assignments just how much time you spend), you won't really know how well you are doing throughout the semester, and your final grade rests heavily on the final and two lab reports.
Yes, it is a nice accompaniment to the lecture course.
If you're considering this class, you likely need it for your major or premed anyways, so yes I'd recommend taking this class because you kinda half to.
Yes, if it's a major prerequisite or requirement. Just be prepared to put in a lot of time for it, which can be frustrating and tedious.

I would if you're interested in doing lab work in the future, because you do learn important procedures. That being said, the grading of assignments was often unclear and frustrating, and the 15-question multiple-choice final exam was pretty ridiculous. So I'd say only take it if you're genuinely interested in the content.
no unless its a req

Yes, I would highly recommend this class to anyone who is interested in developing laboratory technique proficiency and for those who want their lecture experience to be accompanied by a laboratory course. While the grading system can be a little confusing at times, I thoroughly enjoyed this course and would recommend it for anyone in the STEM sciences.
Only if it's required for them to take it
The labs were pretty cool and help you learn organic chemistry, so yes, I would recommend this course in-person.

I would recommend this class to anyone whos taking organic chemistry at the same time. Learning the lab techniques enhanced my learning in the classroom, especially later in the semester when we were working on synthesis with SN2/SN1/E2/E1 reactions.
I doubt anyone takes this as an elective so if you have to take it for your major, it's not terrible and I imagine it would be more fun in person if you could do the lab yourself.
I would because I really enjoyed watching the experiments online throughout the semester and felt like I really had the time to understand the material in this format.

I would not recommend this course to another student unless they needed it for a pre-req. This is because I feel like there are much better, more enriching classes to take than an introductory organic chemistry lab at Yale.
I would recommend this course to anyone taking organic chemistry. The lab complements the lecture well, and is a great introduction to laboratory techniques.
it's a prereq

I would recommend this course to another student, but I would warn them that while it is a 0.5 credit, if it is your first lab class, it feels like a lot more than that. This class has a high workload.
Yes, it's cool to see material you learn in lecture actually be used.

If they need it for a major or a lab requirement, which is probably why most people take this class, then sure. I don't know if this is a lab course anyone would fall in love with, but it's definitely better than gen chem lab, for example.  I do think it's fair to say that the workload of this lab isn't as breezy as I feel like people make it out to be. You do have to put in a fair amount of time each week, and there are occasionally longer assignments on top of that.
Yes. Prof. DiMeglio is caring and understanding and wants to see her students succeed. This course is amazing especially compared to OChem lecture.
Yes
This is a challenging course but very helpful when it comes to actually seeing the applications of what we are taught in organic chemistry
I would recommend this course to another student as I did learn a lot from it.
Yes! Great lab.
Yes, great foundation
-if you must take it
Yes, if needed as a pre-med student or they truly like organic chemistry
Yes, Dr. DiMeglio makes the class super enjoyable for anyone interested in Organic Chemistry.
I would recommend this course. I feel much more comfortable in a lab setting and I feel familiar with many common procedures.

This is a much better lab than gen chem. You really learn how to be a chemist and develop skills in experimentation. Only downside is it is only a half credit but feels like a full credit of work. Weekly experimental plans, lab notes, and quizzes.
I would recommend this course, especially because it is taught in a very organized way.

For sure! You learn the necessary laboratory techniques to build a foundation for more advanced lab work and it feels amazing to be able to put two and two together in terms of the science and theory, and then make the magic happen with your own hands. A great class!!
Yes. Some people are required to take for chem or premed but regardless of that, it is a good class to take alongside orgs 1 where you see how some of the concepts we learn are applied.
Yes! It's a very well-organized lab course with incredibly knowledgeable instructors. The info is all there if you know where to look.
For all of you who just suffered through gen chem, don't sweat this course. It's sooooo much better than gen chem. It's actually a really fun course.
I would recommend this course to another student as it is helpful in applying organic chemistry skills.
I believe that this course is fundamental in developing a variety of techniques that are an absolute necessity within the chemistry laboratory, so yes.
Yes, I would recommend this course if someone is looking to go into research or something related to lab science.

I would really only take this class if you had to. The actual lab component was fine and not too bad and even fun at times, but the extra paperwork before and after lab (especially the post labs) were just super time consuming, not engaging or conducive to learning at all, and regardless of how hard you worked, you were bound to have stupid points taken off anyways.
I would recommend this class to students interested in pre-med, organic chemistry, and/or research, as it teaches the fundamental techniques necessary for basic chemistry and basic science research
Take this class if it is required by your major.
Yes, if you need it!
Yes, it was beneficial to have an actual lab component to organic chemistry and understand the conditions under which reactions we talk about in class take place.
The course has a lot of busy work but it is cool to see how one's first lab notes/ep compares to their last ones.
Yes! It helped me better understand the subjects learned in orgo.
Yes, the labs are very engaging and you learn a lot.
Yes!! It helps to better grasp some concepts from orgo lecture, and is useful to see the real-life application. Dr. DiMeglio is amazing and so kind.

I would not take this course unless needed for the major. Whatever enjoyable moments we had were overshadowed by constant stress of format, many hours in lab, and the time needed for internalizing the material.
I would recommend if this lab is required, otherwise, no.

I would. Christine makes the class enjoyable, she is more than fair and I enjoyed learning from her. We need more teachers like her. Reach out with any concerns, she is actually there to help you learn. It was refreshing to have that type of energy.

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student. The hands-on experience from the lab is extremely helpful in understanding reactions and allows you to put your knowledge from orgo lectures into action. This course is different from just sitting in a classroom or listening to lectures while taking notes. Overall, this lab is great!

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student. DiMeglio does an excellent job at teaching basic lab procedures that are fundamental to organic chemistry, and these labs help add value to the concepts discussed in organic chemistry lecture.
Yes, I definitely recommend this course! I love the professor and the concepts that we learn during lab!
I believe I would recommend the in-person course. Students need hands-on experience to get the most out of a lab course.
Yes, especially if you enjoy organic chemistry and want to understand some of its real world applications. Be prepared for a lot of work
Yes, this course ties in well to the regular organic chemistry course.

extras.title:
CHEM 222L 01
        Lab for Organic Chemistry I
